A custom runtime exception thrown when an organization lookup fails to find a matching organization entity in the system.

## Key Components

- **OrganizationNotFoundException** - Runtime exception class extending `RuntimeException`
- **Constructor** - Takes an `organizationId` parameter and generates a formatted error message

## Usage Example

```java
// Throwing the exception when organization lookup fails
public Organization findById(String organizationId) {
    Optional<Organization> org = repository.findById(organizationId);
    if (org.isEmpty()) {
        throw new OrganizationNotFoundException(organizationId);
    }
    return org.get();
}

// Catching and handling the exception
try {
    Organization org = organizationService.findById("invalid-id");
} catch (OrganizationNotFoundException e) {
    logger.error("Failed to find organization", e);
    // Handle missing organization scenario
}
```

This exception provides clear error messaging by automatically formatting the organization ID into a descriptive message: "Organization not found: {organizationId}". As a runtime exception, it doesn't require explicit handling but can be caught when specific error handling logic is needed.
